channel.title: Thoughts by Liz Carey
channel.description: Recent content on Thoughts by Liz Carey

item.title: Reflecting on Christmas with the family
item.description: A sign of getting older is when visiting home becomes more stressful, than not. With every year that passes, a responsbility is added and layered to your plate. Holidays are no longer about about predicting what gifts I’ll receive, but rather headcount and logistics planning, including meal prep. 2018 Carey family Christmas menu: Mixed salad Roasted root vegetables (recipe from NYT Cooking) Mashed potatoes Beef tenderloin with horseradish crème fraîche sauce (recipe from Serious Eats ) Apple crisp Christmas Eve Shopping tips:

item.title: About
item.description: This website is a work in progress…just. like. me. Hopefully I’ll have this up and running with content sooooooon. Boredom is the only real tragedy for a writer; everything else is material. ― Andrew Sean Greer, Less Bay Area native, born and raised, I currently work as a User Experience researcher based in San Francisco. I work in both qualitative and quantitative methods.

item.title: Starting a blog
item.description: I finally started a blog! I first thought about starting a blog 3 years ago. I never went through it because: I didn’t know where to begin I couldn’t think of any content Laziness The trick is to set aside a few hours and commit. If you’re familiar with R, the only resource you need is Yihui Xie’s blogdown book. Here are key tips that helped me publish this blog:

item.title: Home
item.description: A very work in progress personal website WELCOME. Thanks for stopping by, hopefully you find something you enjoy.
